item.title: Venezuela’s oil facilities unscathed in US strike, sources say
item.description: Venezuela's state-run oil production and refining were operating normally on Saturday and suffered no damage from a US strike to extract the country's president, two sources with knowledge of the operations of energy company PDVSA said. US forces captured President Nicolas Maduro, US President Don

item.title: World reacts to US strikes on Venezuela
item.description: Following are reactions to Saturday's US strikes on Venezuela. RUSSIA FOREIGN MINISTRY "This morning, the United States committed an act of armed aggression against Venezuela. This is deeply concerning and condemnable." "The pretexts used to justify such actions are unfounded. Ideological animos

item.title: Shocked Venezuelans hunker down, unsure of what comes next
item.description: Venezuelan security forces patrolled largely empty streets at dawn in the capital, Caracas, on Saturday, hours after loud explosions woke residents to the news that US commandos had bombed the country and captured President Nicolas Maduro. Streets close to the Miraflores presidential palace were d

item.title: ‘Mobs’ being used to cancel nominations: Manna
item.description: Mahmudur Rahman Manna, president of the Nagorik Oikko, has alleged that valid nominations are being cancelled “by force and by creating mobs”. He made the complaint on Saturday evening after leaving the returning officer’s office in Segunbagicha, Dhaka. The Nagorik Oikko chief s

item.title: Rastro Songskar’s Hasnat Kaiyum knocked out of Kishoreganj-5 race after scrutiny
item.description: Hasnat Kaiyum, chief coordinator of Rastro Songskar Andolan, has been ruled ineligible to run for parliament from the Kishoreganj-5 constituency. Independent aspirant Sheikh Mujibur Rahman Iqbal, president of the Upazila unit of the BNP, has also been barred from standing for that seat, bdnews24.c

item.title: Govt committed to ensuring justice in Osman Hadi murder: Foreign adviser
item.description: Foreign Affairs Adviser Md Touhid Hossain has said that the government is committed to bringing those involved in the murder of Osman Hadi to justice. The adviser said, "The process is continuing to complete the trial as quickly as possible." “We cannot rush the judicial process. We are try

item.title: Family moved by nation’s outpouring of grief for Khaleda Zia: Tarique
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman said on Saturday his family has been deeply moved by the continued outpouring of condolences and prayers from across the country and abroad following the death of his mother and former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia. In a post on his official Facebook page, “As

item.title: Venezuela vice president Rodriguez in Russia, four sources say
item.description: Venezuelan Vice President Delcy Rodriguez is in Russia, four sources familiar with her movements said on Saturday, after President Donald Trump said President Nicolas Maduro had been seized by US forces after an attack on the country. Her brother, Jorge Rodriguez, the head of the national assembly

item.title: Wahiduzzaman promoted to director of Bangladesh Bank
item.description: Wahiduzzaman Sardar, previously serving as additional director, has been promoted to the position of director (Research) at Bangladesh Bank. The central bank’s Human Resources Department-1 issued an official notification regarding the promotion on Thursday, January 1. Wahiduzzaman began his

item.title: Brazil says US crossed 'unacceptable line' over military strikes on Venezuela
item.description:
Brazil's President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva on Saturday condemned the U.S. military attack on neighbor Venezuela and the capture of his Venezuelan counterpart Nicolas Maduro, saying it crossed "an unacceptable line."
"These acts represent a grave affront to Venezuela's sovereignty and yet

item.title: Advisor Fouzul to meet stakeholders amid LPG market volatility
item.description: The price of a 12 kg LPG cylinder, officially fixed at Tk 1,253, has climbed by nearly Tk 1,000 in parts of Dhaka, leaving household users struggling as supplies tighten across the capital. Against this backdrop, Power and Energy Advisor Fouzul Kabir Khan has said he will sit in discussions with s

item.title: JCD vows to confront conspiracies under Tarique Rahman’s leadership
item.description: Bangladesh Jatiyatabadi Chhatra Dal (JCD) President Rakibul Islam Rakib on Saturday said the organisation would firmly confront all ongoing conspiracies against the country under the leadership of BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman.
